summary: To initiate an ApoB-lowering nutrition plan focused on high fiber and unsaturated fats.
trigger: Rohan's lab results showed elevated ApoB at 115 mg/dL and hs-CRP at 2.8 mg/L, indicating increased cardiovascular risk.
rationale: Dr. Warren's primary goal was to lower these markers through an aggressive lifestyle intervention before considering medication.
Carla proposed a plan focused on high fiber, healthy fats, and reduced saturated fat specifically to target ApoB.
Rohan agreed to the nutritional plan, asking for it to be simple and practical.
